meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be substituted for one another.
meanings.sent1: In cooking, the intersubstitutability of ingredients allows for flexibility in recipes.
meanings.sent2: The intersubstitutability of pens means you can use any color to write a note.
meanings.sent3: The intersubstitutability of hats in the costume shop led to a mix-up during the play.
meanings.sent4: Her intersubstitutability in the team made her the go-to player in any position.
meanings.sent5: The intersubstitutability of keys in the lock made it easy to open the door.

meanings.definition: The ability for one thing to be replaced by another without affecting the overall outcome.
meanings.sent1: The intersubstitutability of batteries means you can use any brand in the remote control.
meanings.sent2: In a pinch, the intersubstitutability of tools allows for quick repairs with whatever is on hand.
meanings.sent3: The intersubstitutability of actors in the play caused confusion during rehearsals.
meanings.sent4: His intersubstitutability in the team made him a valuable asset in any situation.
meanings.sent5: The intersubstitutability of coins in the vending machine made it easy to get a snack.
